name: Penelopognathus
overview: Penelopognathus is a genus of hadrosauroid dinosaur which lived in the Early Cretaceous Bayin-Gobi Formation in what is now China. The discovery of this taxon contributes to the hypothesis that hadrosauroids originated in Asia. The type species, Penelopognathus weishampeli, named after David Weishampel, was described by Godefroit, Li, and Shang in 2005, based on fragmentary jaw fossils.

researchContext.evidenceBase: Penelopognathus is represented by published fossil material, but completeness and diagnostic overlap can limit high-confidence biological reconstruction.
researchContext.currentLimits: Several ecological and life-history traits remain inferential rather than directly measured for this taxon.
researchContext.nextDataNeeded: Priority evidence includes better-preserved cranial/postcranial overlap, robust stratigraphic control, and specimen-linked morphometrics.
researchContext.revisionOutlook: Interpretation is expected to improve as new finds and reanalyses clarify taxonomy and anatomy.

funFacts: Penelopognathus remains an active target for revision as new material is compared across related taxa.
Dino-pedia marks uncertain claims explicitly so this article can be upgraded with specimen-level evidence.
